page.title: 01STOCKSBRIDGE SOUTH YORKSHIRE
page.content:
SITUATED IN A VALLEY,10 MILES NORTH WEST OF SHEFFIELD,THIS TOWNSHIP OF 14,000 INHABITANTS,DEPENDS BASICALLY ON THE STEELWORKS (B.S.C.) WHICH FROM HUMBLE BEGINNINGS (SAMUEL FOX) IN THE MID-19TH CENTURY, PEAKED TO 8,200 EMPLOYEES IN 1958/59 WHEN DEMAND FOR STEEL WAS AT ITS HIGHEST AND HAS NOW LEVELLED OUT AT 3,500.
THE STEELWORKS NESTLE ALONG THE VALLEY WITH THE SHOPPING CENTRE RUNNING PARALLEL.ON THE SOUTHERLY BANKS LIE THE WELL DEFINED HOUSING ESTATES WHILST TO THE NORTH LIE GREEN FIELDS SOON TO BE BISECTED BY A BY_PASS.NOW A PART OF THE CITY OF SHEFFIELD STILL REMAINS AN INSULARITY DUE LARGELY TO ITS RATHER ISOLATED SITUATION.
